reviews.review_msg: Bing is a very nice professor. The course material is straightforward, and the exam is based on lecture slides.

This prof is incredibly horrible. He barely teaches & doesn't explain things but somehow expects you to learn by osmosis. You're better off with another instructor because this one doesn't care about your learning. Very condescending to the students in class, calling people out & then being rude to them as if they were stupid. AVOID at all costs.

This professor is accessible if you ask for help and is definitely willing to support students. Tests are a bit vaguely-worded but overall if you need assistance he will be there to give it. Attending lectures is super important because a lot of information is provided that end up on quizzes.

Unapproachable professor, tests have unclear language (impossible to know what's actually being asked), speak up and you'll be reprimanded.

It's worth noting that a particular dynamic is used in several previous posts, and the style of writing in all his good reviews are comparable. Just a word to the wise. His reputation will live on elsewhere.
Attendance for lectures are mandatory, crucial for understanding certain concept. Great prof, great person.

Knowledge prof and hilarious guy. Very kind person too. He was like a guardian looking out for our best interests. One of the best courses I have taken so far at SFU! Thanks for a wonderful semester Shiv!

Enjoyed this class very much. Cool Prof and honest person! He knows his stuff too. I liked how he treated the tech guys with respect when the computer equipment failed massively a couple times!! I was impressed. Will look to take more classes with this Prof.

My only beef with this class would be that the text was NOT AT ALL linked to the class. Other than that, lectures are to the point, informative, and a must to attend (although slides are posted, there is some info he removes when he posts them). easy assignments, and tests if you go to lecture.
Super prof ! Interacted with him at office hours. He is down to earth and always respectful. I got a decent grade and will take more courses with him. TA Liliana was the sore point of the class...
Balram encourages independent thinking and is eager to help, however, the exams were difficult, and the labs were tedious and frustrating.

The course was way too easy for me. The labs are trivial, the only benefit is you learn a RS software. The prof seems like a nice person, but many times he is not sure how to answer some class questions.

He is a nice guy; he has strong interest in Remote Sensing. The labs are an easy mark, just make sure yo work with lab partners to make sure your doing it right. The exams are harder, but the labs are are weighed 60% and exams 40%. So if you do well on the labs you will do well in the class. Nice guy, and a good teacher.

Super nice down to earth guy. Not very confident, but he is clear in what he teaches, you can ask him questions at any time, and the assignments and tests are super easy. Very easy to get an A in this course if you actually study and try to understand what is going on
Not the most confident guy and he makes his lectures super boring. But tests are short and fairly simple. And labs are coordinated and he walks you through every step.
The course was patchy. Topics and labs seems out of sync. I paid a fee for field trip but we had none. They picked my pocket!! What a shame...
I understand the Prof is new, but that's no excuse for the poor management and organization of the course. I fear taking other courses with this Prof. I will change to the PG stream instead.

This is a fragmented course at best. It is pitched at a very high level too. I hated almost everything about how this course was handled and delivered. Most people I know stayed on because the course is compulsory. What a waste!!

Scattered bits of material, and then the final unexpectedly asks you to pull it all together. No one really did, eg final exam highest mark was 87. And final grades scaled ... down? 70=C- and 60=D? Well, it was his first term at SFU. Hopefully he'll improve.
I am very disappointed with this course. Structurally, it is all over the place. The only reason I didn't withdraw is because this is a compulsory course.
Seems like an ok guy, but his energy level is too low to inspire me. Comes across as painfully slow and boring!! He even acknowledges that. Yikes!
Thanks to this Prof, I now have a strong dislike for remote sensing. Everything about the course was just disjointed. Shame on the department of geography!
The prof is a graduate student with poor Q skills. She couldn't figure out simple matrix algebra. Wasted my time with this course. Don't take this course folks, your GPA will take a hit.

Prof is very disorganized and was unprepared most of the times. She says things and don't keep her words - missed many appointments and office hours for example. I paid real money for this course and expected much more out of it.
She seems like a nice person, but not a good teacher. Missed many office hours and came to class unprepared. We didn't even know our grade bands until after the last class... Avoid this course...
Great prof

Take the other reviews with a grain of salt. This term, Eva was available after class during lab to help with assignments, even staying with some students until almost 8pm on several occasions (class was 2:30-4:30, lab was 4:30-6:30). Final exam change, while annoying, was more SFU's fault than prof's. Lectures are a bit long though.

As experienced as Eva is in this field, this course has been a gong show in terms of organization. As late as the day before our final, 5/10 of our labs are unmarked. Lectures are overly content heavy with little to no discussion or practical application. Her friendly exterior is not a reflection of her approachability. Not taking 353.

If not already heavily engaged in course material, this class is very bleh. Professor was all over the place typically and was changing our final exam date multiple times up until a week before. Ta and prof were on different pages with little communication and labs had very poor instructions, so help from the ta was mandatory. Dont take unless need

Lectures easy to follow and all test materials came from the lecture, she's happy to answer any questions in class and goes over all tests with you. Labs can get a bit confusing but she makes herself available in the lab along with the TA to help you out.
